lines.text: I was born to murder the world.
A lot of people believed in Nix. They haven't forgotten his promise.
About...?
Death.
What about death?
It's an illusion.
What ARE you?
A man who wanted to become a god... then changed his mind.
[first lines]

[fire in his hand]
And the fire said to me, said to me... Nix, Nix, you are my instrument. From now on you shall be known as "The Puritan".
What's the story? Was the kid really possessed?
Probably.
You gonna tell me by what?
Oh, you know, the usual.
Taste the darkness, D'Amour, it's been waiting for you.
You ever watched a man die? If you watch very closely, you can sometimes see the soul escaping. And if you're very quick, you can catch it.

[to D'Amour]
You don't have a clue what you're into, did you?
I feel it!

[to Tapert]
Shhhh.
Deep shit?

[talking about Nix]
Think he'll be in a fit state to resurrect after 13 years?
If he was just a man, like me, then no. But... he's not.
What is he, then?
Maybe he'll show you.
I've got so much power to give you, Swann. All you have to do is beg.
Fuck you.
Are you ready for my wisdom?
Any movie stars buried here?
Probably.
It's not a bad place. It's warm, lots of palm trees.
I don't think the dead much care.
You sure?
Are you a believer, then?
Oh, yeah. I signed on for all of them in my time. Catholic, Hindu, Moonies. You can't have too many saviors.
[first lines]

There are two worlds of magic. One is the glittering domain of the illusionist. The other is a secret place, where magic is a terrifying reality. Here, men have the power of demons. And Death itself is an illusion.

[missing body]
He got up and walked!
After that fall he would have broken half his bones.
I don't think he'd have given a shit.
[last lines]
Flesh is a trap... that's what he used to say... flesh is a trap, and magic sets us free.
Where did the flower go?
